0: The rate-setting Federal Open Market Committee has issued five straight unanimous policy statements. Thursday could see the first dissenting votes of 2015, whether the Fed raises rates or not. Richmond Fed President Jeffrey Lacker, who is a voting member of the FOMC this year, said there is a strong case to raise rates. While he didn’t dissent at the June policy meeting, “we’re not in the same situation we were in June, so my attitude towards waiting further is going to be different now,” Mr. Lacker said.
